User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

### Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - role

2. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>

3. Director
   - Attributes:
     - officialOffer: Offer

4. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - longList: List<Player>
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>

5. Player
   - Attributes:
     - name
     - attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

6. PlayerAttribute
   - Attributes:
     - name
     - value

7. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes:
     - targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>
     - otherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

8. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - scoutingReport: ScoutingReport

9. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - pros
     - cons
     - recommendation

10. ShortList
    - Attributes:
      - players: List<Player>

11. Offer
    - Attributes:
      - player: Player

### Associations:
- HeadCoach has designatedPlayerProfiles (1 to many relationship with PlayerProfile)
- Scout has longList (1 to many relationship with Player)
- Scout has scoutingAssignments (1 to many relationship with ScoutingAssignment)
- Player has attributes (1 to many relationship with PlayerAttribute)
- PlayerProfile has targetPositions (1 to many relationship with PlayerPosition)
- PlayerProfile has otherAttributes (1 to many relationship with PlayerAttribute)
- ScoutingAssignment has player (1 to 1 relationship with Player)
- ScoutingAssignment has scoutingReport (1 to 1 relationship with ScoutingReport)
- ShortList has players (1 to many relationship with Player)
- Offer has player (1 to 1 relationship with Player)

...

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.

### Classes:
1. Employee(role: String): Represents an employee in the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(officialOffer: Offer): Represents the director of the club who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting assignments.
5. Player(name: String, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name and attributes.
6. PlayerAttribute(name: String, value: String): Represents an attribute of a player identified by a name and value.
7. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player profile with target positions and other attributes.
8. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment for a player with a scouting report.
9. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: String): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
10. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players.
11. Offer(player: Player): Represents an offer made by the director for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute(name, value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by a name and a value.
3. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

### Classes:
1. Employee(role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director: Represents the director of the club who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting assignments.
5. Player(attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with various attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment carried out by a scout for a player.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
8. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players selected for further evaluation.
9. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

2. PlayerAttribute
   - Name
   - Value

3. Recommendation
   - KeyPlayer
   - FirstTeamPlayer
   - ReserveTeamPlayer
   - ProspectivePlayer
   - NotAGoodSigning

## Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
   - Attributes: 
     - Employees (List of Employee)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of ScoutingAssignment)
     - ShortListedPlayers (List of Player)
     - OfficialOffers (List of Offer)

2. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - Role
     - Name

3. HeadCoach
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Methods:
     - IdentifyDesignatedPlayerProfiles()

4. Director
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Methods:
     - MakeOfficialOffer()

5. Scout
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Attributes:
     - LongListedPlayers (List of Player)
     - ScoutingReports (List of ScoutingReport)
   - Methods:
     - EvaluateLongList()
     - SubmitScoutingReport()

6. Player
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Position (PlayerPosition)
     - Attributes (List of PlayerAttribute)

7. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Player (Player)
     - Scout (Scout)
     - RoundsOfScouting
   - Methods:
     - CarryOutScouting()

8. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Player (Player)
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (Recommendation)

9. Offer
   - Attributes:
     - Player (Player)
     - Amount

This class model captures the key entities and relationships described in the given description of the Team Sports Scouting System.

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute(Name, Value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by a name and a value.
3. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(Employees: List<Employee>, ScoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>, ShortListedPlayers: List<Player>, OfficialOffers: List<Offer>): Represents the main system used by club employees for scouting players.
2. Employee(Role, Name): Represents a generic employee in the club with a role and name.
3. HeadCoach(Role, Name): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
4. Director(Role, Name): Represents the director who makes official offers for players recommended for signing.
5. Scout(Role, Name, LongListedPlayers: List<Player>, ScoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport): Represents a scout who notes players in a long list and submits scouting reports.
6. Player(Name, Position: PlayerPosition, Attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, Scout: Scout, RoundsOfScouting): Represents a scouting assignment for a player carried out by a scout.
8. ScoutingReport(Player: Player, Pros, Cons, Recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
9. Offer(Player: Player, Amount): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role):Represents an employee with a specific role in the club.
2. HeadCoach(IdentifiedPlayerProfiles):Manages the identification of designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director():Represents the director of the club.
4. Scout(LongList, ScoutingAssignments):Maintains a long list of potential players and handles scouting assignments.
5. Player(PlayerAttributes):Represents a player with various attributes.
6. ScoutingReport(Pros, Cons, Recommendation):Contains the evaluation and recommendation for a player after scouting.
7. ShortList():Represents the short-listed players for further consideration.
8. ScoutingAssignment():Represents a scouting assignment for investigating a specific player.
9. HeadScout():Represents the head scout responsible for managing scouting activities.
10. OfficialOffer():Represents the official offer made by the director for signing a player.

Classes:
1. Employee(role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(officialOffer: Offer): Represents the director who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting assignments.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...
   
2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

## Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Role
   
2. Player
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Position (PlayerPosition)
     - OtherAttributes (List of Name-Value pairs)
   
3. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - AssignedBy (Employee)
     - AssignedTo (Employee)
     - Status
   
4. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)
   
5. ScoutingRound
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - AssignedBy (Employee)
     - AssignedTo (Employee)
     - Status
   
6. ShortList
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - AssignedBy (Employee)
     - AssignedTo (Employee)
     - Status
   
7. Offer
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Director (Employee)
     - Status

3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach of the club responsible for identifying player profiles.

9. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a shortlist of players for further evaluation.
10. OfficialOffer(player: Player, amount: double): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerRecommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, ...): Represents the recommendations for players based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. Employee(Name: String, Role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a name and role in the scouting system.
2. Player(Name: String, Position: PlayerPosition, Attributes: List<Attribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes in the scouting system.
3. Attribute(Name: String, Value: String): Represents an attribute of a player with a name and value.
4. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, Scout: Employee, ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment linking a player, scout, and scouting report.
5. ScoutingReport(Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with player evaluation and recommendation.
6. ShortList(Players: List<Player>): Represents a list of players shortlisted for further evaluation in the scouting system.
7. OfficialOffer(Player: Player, Director: Employee): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player in the scouting system.
